comments:

Mark, please provide an update on this bug. Is this indeed a showstopper that needs to be fixed in M6.
Reassign to Bianca.  She handles all test log work.

using same driver TPTP-4.2.0-200604131758, test log viewer works fine. 

Paul, can you check if you have all three BIRT dependency installed?
#  Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools (BIRT) 2.1.0 RC0  - (optional) required by BIRT report integration with TPTP
# Graphics Editor Framework (GEF) 3.2 M6 - (optional) required only if BIRT is installed
# Data Tools Platform (DTP) 0.9 M6 - (optional) required only if BIRT is installed

(In reply to comment #4)

Yes, I am running a full install except WPT:

Eclipse SDK 3.2.0 M6 
Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF and XSD) SDK 2.2.0 M6 
Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools (BIRT) 2.1.0 RC0
Graphics Editor Framework (GEF) 3.2 M6
Data Tools Platform (DTP) 0.9 M6
Noteworthy, I am seeing this problem with a fresh workspace.

This defect is caused by the following ordered steps:

1) Install:
TPTP SDK V4.2.0 (All)
Eclipse SDK 3.2.0 M6 
Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF and XSD) SDK 2.2.0 M6 

2) Generate the test log.

3) Install:

Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools (BIRT) 2.1.0 RC0
Graphics Editor Framework (GEF) 3.2 M6
Data Tools Platform (DTP) 0.9 M6

4) Opening the test log.

However, the problem is resolved when Eclipse is restarted after step #3 with the -clean Eclipse option.

As such, this defect is not a blocking issue for exiting the TPTP V4.2.0 (i2) test pass.  However, this issue may still be experienced by the user since the -clean Eclipse option is not a requirement for running TPTP.  We should, at a minimum, readme the workaround.  Ideally, we should resolve the issue.  Therefore, decreasing the severity to normal.

This is a feature/issue with eclipse platform, not TPTP.

After the first time you start eclipse, it caches the loaded plugin settings under eclipse/configuration/. If you changed the install of your eclipse shell (added additional dependencies or replaces jar files etc.) which conflict with the cached settings of eclipse, the cached ones will be used. "-clean" or removing the plugin folders under eclipse/configuration/ (except the config.ini file), eclipse will start clean.

End users are not expected to change eclipse installs. They usually have the dependencies and environment set up right and use it later on. Plugin developers like us however have this problem constantly when we change the dependencies or installs. I'm closing this defect since Test Log Viewer works fine in this driver.

Paul if you install manually the plugins then you always need to run (at least the first time) using -clean to update the plugin registry.

Bianca you could also check Bundle.getState() (I think for RESOLVED state) when you set isBIRTAvailable flag or probably more safe try to load a class that depends on Birt code and check for NoClassDefFoundError.

Test Log Viewer is checking BIRT availability by test loading BIRT charting core class "org.eclipse.birt.chart.engine" already. BIRT is an optional dependency from the beginning. I've tried with the same build, removed all BIRT plugins, and restarted TPTP (with -clean). Test Log Viewer still works fine without the pie chart.

(In reply to comment #11)

The bundle can be in some unresolvable state like in the case hit by Paul. Checking for RESOLVED state beside null might help.
Will there be code changes for Comment #13?  If so, we can use this defect.

(In reply to comment #8)

I have opened https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=137645 to add a note to the Installation Guide to start TPTP with the -clean option after a configuration change .

Checked in code in comment #13 to handle the case when BIRT dependency is partially installed and can't be resolved.

Thanks Marius for the suggestion.
